snippet: Antigovernment demonstrators in Russia were met by a huge contingent of police officers, and prominent opposition leaders were arrested during the rally Saturday afternoon.
abstract: Leaders of Russian political opposition take to streets for unsanctioned demonstration in Moscow and are met by huge contingent of riot police officers, who quickly cordon off area and begin making arrests.

byline.original: By DAVID M. HERSZENHORN and ANDREW E. KRAMER
byline.contributor: Ellen Barry and Andrew Roth contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: Antigovernment demonstrators in Russia were met by a huge contingent of police officers, and prominent opposition leaders were arrested during the rally Saturday afternoon.

headline.seo: Despite Threat of Steep Fines, Protesters Turn Out in Moscow
headline.main: Protesters in Moscow Stage New Demonstration
headline.print_headline: Under Threat of Fines, Moscow Protesters Turn Out
